extension_name.message: Videochat Extension - IP Locator for Omegle

extension_description.message: IP Locator & more for Omegle-like randomized video chats: Omegle, ome.tv, Chatruletka. Previously known as Chatruletka Extension.

desc.message: This is a browser extension that extends the functionality of Omegle-like randomized video chats.

screen_remote.message: Make a screenshot from the interlocutor's camera

screen_local.message: Make a screenshot from your camera

pip_remote.message: Open the video from the stranger's camera in picture-in-picture mode

pip_local.message: Open the video from your camera in picture-in-picture mode

firefoxHandlePip.message:
On chromium browsers this button is used to activate the picture-in-picture mode, which allows you to open the video in a small window on top of other windows.

Unfortunately, in Firefox we cannot programmatically activate this mode, but it can be activated manually.

firefoxHandleStreamerPip.message:
this toggles echo-video visibility.

it is used in streamer mode to watch your interlocutors while they are covered/blurred and decide whether you should uncover/unblur them.

unfortunately this is the only way to get the same functionality as in chrome, because Picture-In-Picture in firefox acts weird.

FYI: chrome extension opens echo-video in the PiP mode.

main.message:
Important:
This extension is a hobby project and is not affiliated with '$1' in any way.

main2.message:
Important:
This extension is a hobby project and is not affiliated with '$1' in any way.

P.S. 'Advanced' mode for Omegle is still work-in-progress, expect minor bugs and missing features.

mainHint.message:
$3

Did you know?
$2

mainDiscord.message:
Important:
The extension community is hosted on Discord.

On our Discord server you can subscribe to project updates, report a bug, suggest a feature, get technical help and discuss the extension with the developer and other users.

apiStatus0.message: IP geolocation API doesn't work at all, check if vpn/adblock is blocking the connection: try disabling adblock, adding ip-api.com to whitelist or even using another browser. If that didn't work for you, please ask the developer for help via discord.

apiStatusRegular.message: Please report the issue to discord.

apiStatus429.message: Too many requests, please try again later.

github.message: More useful information: github.

hotkeys.message: <dd>left arrow - skip</dd><dd>shift+left arrow - skip+ban</dd><dd>up arrow - stop</dd><dd>down arrow - report</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>left arrow - cancel report</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>right arrow - send report</dd>

tooltipShowHeaderVersion.message: if enabled, the version of the extension will be displayed in the header of the control panel

showHeaderVersionFull.message: show full version in the header:

tooltipShowHeaderVersionFull.message: if enabled, the extension version will be displayed uncut

tooltipWatermark.message: hides the watermark in the upper left corner of the interlocutor's camera

tooltipBanner.message: hides the banner with the current instance logo, current overall online, and mobile applications

tooltipFour.message: automatically skip interlocutors that are taking more than 4 seconds to connect to

tooltipAutoskipWrongCountry.message: automatically skip if you are looking for someone from X country but chatruletka found you someone from Y country

tooltipForcedRecognition.message: continues to determine the gender of the interlocutor even if the gender skipping is disabled

tooltipSkipMales.message: tries to determine the gender of the interlocutor and skips if faceapi is 90 percent sure that the gender of the interlocutor is male

tooltipSkipFemales.message: tries to determine the gender of the interlocutor and skips if faceapi is 90 percent sure that the gender of the interlocutor is female

tooltipAutoskip.message: automatically adds the interlocutor's IP to the blacklist, if he/she was automatically skipped by gender

tooltipDonotbanmobile.message: Prohibits adding mobile IP addresses to the blacklist. They are temporary and can be used by many users. Please disable if IP API is not working.

tooltipSkipSound.message: plays sound when added to the blacklist and when the banned interlocutor skips

tooltipEnableHotkeys.message: Enable cool arrows hotkeys. This does not affect the extension hotkeys that are configured in the browser settings. If you accidentally pressed a key, hold for 5 seconds before releasing so that the extension can understand that there is no need to process.

tooltipSentry.message: allows the extension to collect information about its errors and send them to sentry.io

reloadRequired.message: PAGE RELOAD IS REQUIRED BECAUSE YOU HAVE CHANGED SOME IMPORTANT SETTINGS

tooltipStreamerMode.message: Enables a special set of functions for streamers. If you disable it, everything below will not work.

obsHelpSwalHtml.message:
you have activated a special section that contains features that make video chats more suitable for broadcasting on YouTube and other services.

* temporarily lower the volume of the interlocutor
— by holding down the 'm' button / 'm' key.
— allows you to avoid echo on the broadcast.
* integration with obs
— allows you to display geolocation data in the text source.
— allows you to control the visibility of the image, which covers the video while you look for a suitable interlocutor.
— you can activate the cover with the h / right arrow key or the h button on the control panel.
* blur & cover
— allows you to cover the interlocutor's camera with a blur/picture/gif and look at it through picture-in-picture mode to decide if the interlocutor is suitable to show to your audience.
— you have to capture the browser, not the whole screen, in your program for streaming. then you open the chat site, click on the green button in the upper left corner of the control panel (enables picture-in-picture mode), and the video from the stranger's camera will open in a separate window that will be on top of all the windows! this video will not be visible on the broadcast, but you will see it!
— you can activate the cover with the h / right arrow key or the h button on the control panel.

Streamer mode, like other extension modules, is well customizable: for example, you can apply a gray filter while the interlocutor is covered in obs, set your own picture to cover the interlocutor, or choose one of ours. Most of the features require some configuration before you can use them, but I have tried to make it as easy as possible.

Please note that not all platforms allow users to stream random video chats: for example, youtube is tolerant of this, but the twitch community guidelines explicitly state that "Use randomized video chat services" is forbidden.

Beware of a man-in-the-middle attack!
— You need to remember that a cover does not give you absolute security.
— For example, some kid with OBS can start two video chats and show you a real person, and then do something nasty on his camera.
— You should keep your finger on the right arrow of the keyboard. Left arrow - skip, up arrow - stop, right arrow - toggle cover. What could be more convenient?

tooltipStreamerBlurCoverSection.message: Enable if you want to hide your stranger's camera feed. You will be able to capture just the browser in OBS, cover the stranger with custom image/gif, and look at him through picture-in-picture mode to decide whether to show him on yout broadcast.

tooltipStreamerHotkeys.message: enable a special set of hotkeys for streamers. they are used mostly to quickly activate the streamer buttons in the header of the extension

streamerHotkeysText.message: <dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>h / right arrow - blur / cover</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>m - mute remote video</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>hold m - suppress the volume (temp.)</dd>

tooltipSuppressVolumeValue.message: Set the volume that will be set for your interlocutor while you hold the "m" key / button. The stranger's volume will be temporarily set to this value, and after the hold is released, the previous volume will be restored. Very useful for echo cancellation: hold down a key -> speak -> release after a bit.

tooltipObsIntegrationSection.message: enables integration with Open Broadcaster Software (the most popular social media streaming software). It allows the extension to output the location of the interlocutor and control the image that covers his image.

tooltipObsShowErrorsStatus.message: show errors & status of connection in the left bottom corner.

tooltipObsControlCover.message: allows the extension to control the visibility of the image that covers the interlocutor. many streamers do this in order to be able to turn off the image of the interlocutor on the live stream at any time. you need to create any source in the OBS named VE_COVER and place it above the image of the interlocutor. Now you can toggle this VE_COVER visibility with one button (h/H) / by pressing a shorcut (h / right arrow) / automatically (configurable at the very bottom)

tooltipObsControlCoverGrayscale.message: turns on the gray filter while the stranger is covered in the OBS. I highly recommend using this function, because it asks obs at the start of each dialogue if VE_COVER is visible in the active scene. This greatly reduces the chance of error and gives you a sense of security. for example, if you manually change the scene or visibility of VE_COVER, the extension will ignore it, otherwise you will notice that something has happened.

tooltipObsControlGeolocation.message: displays the location of the stranger in the text source named VE_TEXT in the active scene. first, of course, you need to create a VE_TEXT text source and style it however you like.

promptObsControlGeolocationTextFormUsual.message:
here you can define how geolocation data will be turned into text for:
* regular wired ip (this means high accuracy).

`$1`

$2

promptobsControlGeolocationTextFormMobil.message:
here you can define how geolocation data will be turned into text for:
* mobile ip (this means low accuracy).

`$1`

$2

promptobsControlGeolocationTextFormProxy.message:
here you can define how geolocation data will be turned into text for:
* vpn/proxy/tor/hosting ip (this means very low accuracy, probably fake location).

`$1`

$2

promptFormatSrc.message:
these special words will be replaced with actual data:

* \n -> break line
* $$status -> json.status (success)
* $$country -> json.country (Australia)
* $$countryCode -> json.countryCode (AU)
* $$region -> json.region (QLD)
* $$regionName -> json.regionName (Queensland)
* $$city -> json.city (South Brisbane)
* $$lat -> json.lat (-27.4766)
* $$lon -> json.lon (153.0166)
* $$timezone -> json.timezone (Australia/Brisbane)
* $$isp -> json.isp (Cloudflare, Inc)
* $$mobile -> json.mobile (false)
* $$proxy -> json.proxy (false)
* $$hosting -> json.hosting (true)

tooltipBlurPreviews.message: blur the preview in case your interlocutor uses a custom client that sends NSFW previews

tooltipPreviewBlurStrength.message: value for the preview blur filter

tooltipBlurCoverLocal.message: enable this if you also want to blur/cover your local video (mirror)

tooltipCoverOverBlur.message: enable this if you want to use a img/gif instead of just blurring video. you will be able to choose your own cover to stand out from the crowd!

tooltipBlurOnStart.message: every new conversation will start blurred / covered. remember: you need to enable BLUR / COVER or OBS INTEGRATION first.

tooltipCoverOverPreview.message: enable this if you want to auto-enable blur/cover at 'preview' stage

tooltipCoverOverNoise.message: enable this if you want to auto-enable blur/cover at 'search' stage

tooltipCoverOverStop.message: enable this if you want to auto-enable blur/cover at 'stop' stage

tooltipUncoverOnPlay.message: enable this if you want to use the cover only as a replacement for the search noise

promptCoverSrc.message: Enter a direct link to the picture/gif (4:3) for use as the cover.

promptRandomGiphyTag.message: Enter the query you want to use for the random gif.

tooltipDoNotReflect.message: turn it on if you are uncomfortable seeing yourself reflected

doNotCover.message: do not crop the interlocutor's camera:

tooltipDoNotCover.message: enable this if you are uncomfortable looking at a cropped picture from mobile devices and want to see your interlocutor, and not the edge of his head

tooltipHideCamera.message: enable it to hide your camera to make the conversation more natural

tooltipCustomApiBehaviour.message: turn on if you want to configure which providers to use for your geolocation requests. the providers are arranged in order of use, if first one fails, the extension will try the next one and so on until the last one

tooltipAllowVeApiPatron.message: If you are not logged into your account in the extension menu, it has no effect. If enabled, a service available only to our patrons will be used. Under the hood, it uses a hundreds of times more expensive geolocation service that returns more accurate information about the location of the interlocutor. First you need to subscribe to a patreon (more details in the extension menu by clicking on its icon), then go to your account and turn it on in the settings (in the menu). Then reload the page and enjoy.

tooltipAllowVeApi.message: turn this on if you want to use the videochat extension's server to process geolocation requests. we use the ip-api.com's paid service, so the data will not be different, but our server is used by default because it helps avoid issues with http restrictions and has twice the limit per minute than ip-api.com. our server's source code can be found on github.

tooltipAllowIpApi.message: turn this on if you want to use the service 'ip-api.com' to process geolocation requests. we have used this service as the only one for many years: it is very fast and reliable, gives acceptable data quality and is free for non-commercial use. cons: the free version only works via http (some users may have technical issues) and has a limit of 45 requests per minute. to avoid this issues we started using our own server with a paid subscription to the same service by default.

tooltipAllowGeoJs.message: turn this on if you want to use the service 'geojs.io' to process geolocation requests. it has low data quality and will most likely never be used, because we use it as a backup service for a backup service.

tooltipApiLocalisation.message: Turn this on to request localized data. Available languages: English, German, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Japanese, Chinese, Russian.

tooltipIpApiPreferredLang.message: Select your preferred language for geolocation data. If there is no translation, data will be in English.

tooltipHideMobile.message: Turn this on so that the city and region will be hidden if the interlocutor has mobile internet. Almost always these data are not correct.

tooltipShowCT.message: Turn this on so that the city and region will be displayed in the 'CT' section if the interlocutor has mobile internet.

tooltipShowMoreInfo.message: Enable this to display additional information about the IP address. Mobile - mobile (cellular) connection. Hosting -  proxy, VPN or Tor exit address. Hosting - hosting, colocated or data center.

tooltipShowISP.message: Enable this to show ISP (Internet Service Provider) data if available.

tooltipAutoOpenPopup.message: If enabled, in the 'map' section, a window with information about the location will open automatically. If disabled, you can still open it manually.

tooltipAutoFitBounds.message: If enabled, the map will change its scale to fit the estimated area of the interlocutor.

tooltipAutoSetView.message: If enabled, the map will set its center to the stranger's approximate coordinates.

tooltipFilterIgnoreMobile.message: Mobile (cellular) networks are known for inaccurate city/region geolocation. Country-level geolocation works fine. Should extension ignore mobile data when auto-skipping by city/region?

tooltipFilter.message: if enabled, gives access to the 'filter' features. You set a list of countries/regions/cities you want to auto-skip on sight. If your conversation partner's geolocation data matches at least one -> the interlocutor will be auto-skipped.

tooltipFilterCity.message: if interlocutor's city is in provided list (City1, City2, City3) => skip.

promptFilterCity.message:
the city name must be entered exactly as it is returned by the geolocation service (important: you must specify it in the language in which your geolocation service works).

if you enter: 'New York, Jakarta, Berlin', the extension will auto-skip all strangers who are from New York, Jakarta and Berlin.

tooltipFilterRegion.message: if interlocutor's region is in provided list (Region1, Region2, Region3) => skip.

promptFilterRegion.message:
the region (state) must be entered exactly as it is returned by the geolocation service (important: you must specify it in the language in which your geolocation service works).

if you enter: 'Arizona, Queensland, Vermont, Ontario', the extension will auto-skip all strangers from these regions.

tooltipFilterCountry.message: if interlocutor's country code (such as IN / US) is in provided list (XX, YY, ZZ) => skip.

promptFilterCountry.message:
Countries are specified in the two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2). You can open the full list of countries by clicking the button below.

If you enter 'IN, US', the extension will auto-skip all interlocutors from India and the US.

targetSkipMobile.message: skip mobile when searching for a region/city:

tooltipTargetSkipMobile.message: Mobile (cellular) networks are known for inaccurate city/region geolocation. Country-level geolocation works fine. Should extension skip mobile network users when you are targeting for a specific city/region?

tooltipTarget.message: if enabled, gives access to the 'target search' features. you set a list of countries/regions/cities you want to communicate with. If your conversation partner's geolocation data matches at least one list - you will have a great chat! If there are no matches -> the interlocutor will be auto-skipped.

tooltipTargetCity.message: if interlocutor's city is not in provided list (City1, City2, City3) => skip.

promptTargetCity.message:
the city name must be entered exactly as it is returned by the geolocation service (important: you must specify it in the language in which your geolocation service works).

if you enter: 'New York, Jakarta, Berlin', the extension will auto-skip all strangers whose city is not in the list.

tooltipTargetRegion.message: if interlocutor's region is not in provided list (Region1, Region2, Region3) => skip.

promptTargetRegion.message:
the region (state) must be entered exactly as it is returned by the geolocation service (important: you must specify it in the language in which your geolocation service works).

if you enter: 'Arizona, Queensland, Vermont, Ontario', the extension will auto-skip all strangers whose region/state is not in the list.

tooltipTargetCountry.message: if interlocutor's country code (such as IN / US) is not in provided list (XX, YY, ZZ) => skip.

promptTargetCountry.message:
Countries are specified in the two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2). You can open the full list of countries by clicking the button below.

If you enter 'US, CA', the extension will auto-skip all interlocutors that are not defined as being from the US or Canada.

tooltipTargetSound.message: plays a sound when the target city/region is found

tooltipTorrentsEnable.message: displays a button to search for torrents that your interlocutor probably downloaded (only for those IPs that are not recognized as mobile/tor/proxy)

tooltipTorrentsInfo.message: shows a modal explaining what the 'iknowwhatyoudownload' button means (it reappears after page reloads)

tooltipExpand.message: expands the height of the 'Settings' tab to make it easier to customize

tooltipIgnoreSiteStyles.message: prevents the font size of the control panel elements from changing due to the non-embed style of the video chat site itself

tooltipShowHints.message: if enabled, will show a random 'Did you know?' message every time you open a video chat

tooltipshowHintsMoreOften.message: if enabled, hints will show every time you open a video chat. if disabled, there is only a 33% chance of appearing

tooltipLogToChat.message: if enabled, the extension will output its important log messages to the chat. Examples: auto-skipping notifications, the stranger's IP address, etc.

logIpToChat.message: show IPs in the chat log:

tooltipLogIpToChat.message: if enabled, the extension will output the IP address of your conversation partner to the chat log.

YKWYDHtml.message:
iknowwhatyoudownload is a service that collects data from BitTorrent networks and associates pirate IP addresses with torrent distributions, earning money by working with copyright holders, advertisers and the police.

Simply put, you can find out what your interlocutor could have downloaded from torrents recently.

This is a great opportunity to discuss with the interlocutor his tastes in games, music and cinema!

You should not take this information as one hundred percent (one IP address could be used by several people + the service does not cover all pirate resources), but since the button is not displayed for mobile networks / known VPNs, the chances of success are very high!

Pay attention to the number of torrents: if there are 3-10, then it can be a real person, if there are 30+ of them, probably too many people used the IP address.

If you are a streamer, keep in mind that on the page that opens, the IP addresses of the interlocutor and YOURS ALSO will be displayed!
Make sure that you are using VPN / OBS is configured to capture exactly the Chatruletka window.

After clicking an 'OK' button, a window separate from Chatruletka will open, and if you click the button again, the old service tabs in this window will close.
You can display that new window on a second monitor/half screen.

minimalismExplainHosting.message: — IP address belongs to the data center.

switchModeText.message: Please choose the mode that suits you best.

updateNeedReloadText.message:
Your browser has reloaded the extension, most likely it has downloaded a new version of it!
Please reload the page to restore the work.

welcomeCuriousCheckText.message: I want to learn more and customize the extension:

welcomeCuriousCheckTitle.message: If enabled, the extension will show you more useful (from the developer's point of view) information in the welcome screens. This option is disabled by default because people don't like to read.

welcomeHistoryScanNotFound.message: We did not find supported video chats in your history / they are already in Favorites.

welcomeSwalPermissionContent.message:
The extension doesn't have enough permissions right now.

To activate the necessary features, the extension needs your permission to access video chat sites.

You should see a dialog box by now.

You may not give permission, but then the extension will not work on most sites ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

welcomeSwalTimerText.message: The menu will open in sec.

popupSiteEnabled.message: The extension is active for the site. Click to disable it.

popupSiteDisabled.message: The extension is disabled for the site. Click to enable it.

popupSiteMissingPermission.message: Click to give the extension access to the site.

popupSettingAllowSetLastIcon.message: Change the extension icon to the icon of the last video chat.

popupSettingAllowSetBadgeText.message: Set the text 'ext' below/above the extension icon.

popupSettingLegacyIcon.message: Use legacy icon (disables the dynamic icon and badge)

popupSettingSentry.message: Allow extension to share with sentry.io anonymized information about errors that have occurred.

popupSettingAllowShowChangelog.message: Open changelog when you open a video chat and there was an update in the extension (does not show in minimalist mode).

popupSettingMissingPermissionCheck.message: Allow an extension to request access from you to a supported video chat that you have not yet granted access to.

popupTreePatreonIronCurtainText1.message: For obvious reasons, users in Russia and Belarus may have problems using Patreon.

popupTreePatreonIronCurtainText2.message: Due to imposed sanctions, the platform is technically unable to process payments from local payment systems.

popupTreePatreonIronCurtainText3.message: Besides this, the regulators (internet censors) of these countries also decided to ban Patreon.

popupTreePatreonIronCurtainText4.message: The service itself did not impose any restrictions, but if you do not have access to international payment systems, you will not be able to support our project.

popupTreePatreonPerksAccuracyText1.message: You can significantly improve the accuracy of the geolocation of the interlocutors by supporting the project on Patreon.

popupTreePatreonPerksAccuracyText2.message: For our Patrons, we use hundreds of times more expensive geolocation service, which if used for 100% of users would cost ~5.000$$/month.

popupTreePatreonPerksAccuracyText3.message: Behind the extension is an independent team of just two people: we can't afford that kind of expense.

popupTreePatreonPerksSupportText1.message: Videochat Extension is a free and open-source project: we do not introduce paid features, leaving it up to the video chats themselves.

popupTreePatreonPerksSupportText2.message: For us, the extension is far from being free: development and testing take up significant resources (time), the needs of the project (paying for servers and geolocation services) take up serious money.

popupTreePatreonPerksSupportText3.message: Currently we can afford to spend both money and time (which we have been doing for the last 2.5 years). But our expenses are growing, and this project will need to be supported for a very long time, so the problem with altruism needs to be addressed now.

popupTreePatreonPerksSupportText4.message: Even if 0.1-0.5% of active users decide to support the extension, it will already be enough to pay off all our expenses and ensure the stable development of the project for many years to come: developing new features, fixing bugs and adding support for new video chats!

popupTreePatreonPerksSupportText5.message: We're using hundreds of times more expensive geolocation service for users who support the extension, making it much more accurate! You can learn more about it in the description on Patreon.

popupTreePatreonPerksSupportText6.message: At the end of each month, we publish a big post on Patreon with a report for patrons on the status of the project and the work we've done that month!

popupTreePatreonGuideTitle.message: How do I subscribe to Patreon?

popupTreePatreonGuideText3.message: 3. Login to your account and subscribe.

popupTreePatreonGuideText4.message: 4. Click the 'Login' button in the 'Account' section of the extension's menu (pop-up window).

popupTreePatreonGuideText5.message: 5. If the popup closed during the process, try again.

popupTreePatreonGuideText6.message: 6. Turn on more accurate geolocation in settings and enjoy!

popupTreePatreonAccountQuotaText1.message: We have been forced to implement a quota system that prevents us from spending significantly more money on your requests than we received from Patreon for your subscription.

popupTreePatreonAccountQuotaText2.message: Only those requests for which we had to pay are counted in the quota. If a request was cached (another Patron recently met your interlocutor) - it will not be counted in the quota.

popupTreePatreonAccountQuotaText3.message: The quota size depends on your tier on Patreon. It will be increased in the future. With normal human use, you are unlikely to hit it.

popupTreePatreonAccountQuotaText4.message: If you do run into a quota, you will continue to receive cached data (from other Patrons). If no cached data was found, you'll get data from our public geolocation service.

popupTreePatreonAccountQuotaText5.message: The quota resets every first day of the month.

popupTreePatreonAccountQuotaText6.message: Without this system, bad people could sign up for the smallest tier and artificially make thousands of dollars worth of requests.

popupTreePatreonAccountSettingsWiredEnab.message: Want to request expensive geolocation for wired IP addresses? The accuracy will be much better!

popupTreePatreonAccountSettingsCelluralE.message: Do you want to request expensive geolocation for mobile IP addresses? The accuracy will be almost no different: mobile IPs are known for very poor geolocation quality. Please do not enable.

popupMissingPermissionSwalText.message:
You tried to open $1, which is supported by the Videochat Extension, but you have not yet granted your permission to operate on this site.



Extension supports $2 chat websites already and this optional permission system is the only way that works without disabling the extension on every update.



If you want to disable the extension in a specific video chat, you just need to click on the checkmark in the list to turn it off/on.

popupMissingPermissionSwalDenyButtonText.message: Click to disable this check (not recommended)

tooltipShowChangelogToggle.message: If enabled, when you go to the video chat site and the extension has been updated, a window will open with the changes to let you know what has changed (not shown in minimalist/limited mode).

freecmExtensionHeaderTitle.message: Click to read about the features of the extension on this site.

freecmSettingHideBotsTooltip.message: Videochat Extension will hide videos of detected bots if enabled.

freecmSettingEmojiTooltip.message: Videochat Extension will display '🤖' emoji while the bot's video is hidden.

freecmSettingMuteTooltip.message: Videochat Extension will auto-mute while the bot's video is hidden.

freecmCountriesListTitle.message: Message from $1: You have been identified as $2. You will come across the following countries: $3.

freecmVolumeTitle.message: Click - mute/unmute, scroll up/down to increase/decrease volume.

supportDescFreecm.message: Limited support. Features: bot recognition & interface tweaks.
